page.title: 18Gt. Bromley:American Window.
page.content: {Simon & Gregory Stone}left Gt. Bromley in 1634.They were 2 of the{Founding} {Fathers}:religious exiles from Great Britain who were amongst the 1st people to go & settle in {Massachusetts},Pennsylvania in the {United States of America}. Their American descendents had a {window}built in the church in their memory in 1904.Today,people called Stone still come to see the window and each summer,Great Bromley plays host to many visitors from the U.S.A. The window depicts an{American} {Indian};the Virgin Mary;St. Gregory the Great and Simon & Gregory Stone - all in stained glass. The Stone brothers were born in Great Bromley and were both christened in this church.
